H0.text: Sulfur will most likely increase in the pond when soap containing phosphate pollutes it, causing algae to reproduce rapidly.

H1.text: Oxygen will most likely increase in the pond when soap containing phosphate causes algae to quickly reproduce.

H2.text: Nitrogen will most likely increase in the pond if it is polluted by soap that contains phosphate, which causes the algae to reproduce rapidly.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide is the substance that will most likely increase in a pond when soap containing phosphate causes algae to quickly reproduce.

A4.text: Natural decomposers present in the water begin decomposing the dead algae, consuming dissolved oxygen present in the water during the process.

A5.text: Algae use solar energy to generate biomass from carbon dioxide and are possibly the most important autotrophic organisms in aquatic environments.
